Reviews.Title: Excellent internet/3d tv for your avarage price
Reviews.Author: zeke
Reviews.Content: Pros: Colors, Resolution, Sharpness, WidgetsCons: Gloss(for bright rooms), $$..should be lessI recently just got this and to be honest this is a downgrade since I have an XBR in the bedroom (small 32 inch) but just perfect for my living room.This tv is exceptionally excellent with a sleek look that makes your living room so modern :D I am impressed on how the internet and widget tools are easily installed. Pretty easy and with Sony it already has Sony apps to rent/buy movies and it is also easy to setup for the ps3.The picture quality is amazing. Obviously the XBR is much better but to be honest I can hardly tell that much difference.The only drawback is the gloss and shadow if you have a bright room. Luckily my LR is pretty dark so its perfect with no flaw. If you like sports this tv is insane.If you have a surround system it must be 5.1+ because it wont take white/red conponents for your basic speakers, needs to be optical if not you can always put it in headphones....This has 4 hdmis and really light to lift.If you can afford the price (should be 1200 imo) its an excellent sony tv that has more equal power than other competitors (LGs HD Cinema-Panasonic-Samsung-Sharp Quattro).

Reviews.Title: Not too good, not too bad
Reviews.Author: SylverCloud
Reviews.Content: Was going for a HX929 but the price increase pushed it out of budget and I settled for HX750.This is a decent TV and I found cnet review mostly right. Colours are too good. Watching NGC and Discovery HD is really a treat. Blacks are really black like an other reviewer noted and its incredibly good. Downside is lost shadow detail. Shadow detail is not less, it simply is gone. Dark areas of picture appear totally black with nothing in detail or texture whatsoever. Motion judder is noticeable in standard and smooth modes (which are the ones recommended for regular use). I had compared this one side-by-side with HX 9 series and the latter humbled this at contrast and depth. HX 929 is still probably the best bet. But I felt the difference in picture doesn't justify the huge premium for 9 series.Overall, it might be a good TV, but overpriced for what it gives.**Update**I now painfully learn that what sony says in specs *youtube*, etc widgets have a fine print. That not the same youtube you would find in your browser. Its a server of videos from youtube, converted and reuploaded so that the TVs can play it. The regular browser cannot play even a single video on any website. Sony's explanation is that flash is not supported. This implies you cannot watch youtube live videos. Alas!Its now been 50 days of usage and the unit is running absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: Best Sony Value in their Lineup
Reviews.Author: David L.Camp
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon around Thanksgiving when I wasn't expecting to have to buy a new tv. My previous 40" Sony Z series screen just died unexpectedly and the repairman said it would be $1594.00 to put a new one in. So I researched the sources to get this one which was the same quality level as the Z series and saved $500.00 over the repair cost! Its also 6" bigger diagonally. The picture quality is beautiful and I really can't tell the difference between this one and the 55" HX 850 I bought earlier this summer. Fits nicely in the spot of the old 40 ". Everywhere I went to ask opinions of salespeople about Sony vs. Samsung everyone said they would by Sony with their own money. I might add that this was the first time I've bought an item like a TV on Amazon but it was easy and very quick ( 2days even though I didn't pay for 2 day ship). I wouldn't hesitate to do it with them again.Sound on this model is actually better than my HX 850.Bigger, somewhat front facing speakers at the bottom of the tv. Think this is the best bang for your Sony buck.

Reviews.Title: Top notch, no bleeding
Reviews.Author: R. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Sony back on track after lackluster 2011 screen quality.  My set has no bleeding, no flashlights, perfect picture.  The netflix bugs are fixed... no lag, stuttering, time outs etc.  GREAT TV.

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than 60 days & it stopped working
Reviews.Author: BonJo
Reviews.Content: Our sitch is similar to JDo who posted in June 2012We bought this KDL-46HX750 along with the 55" model of the same, in late October 2012 and this 46" basically died the Friday before Christmas (2012).  It began shutting off within a minute of being powered on...would power back up on its own, then shut off again...then the red LED light in the bottom left corner blinks 8 times, pauses, blinks 8 times, pauses, etc.We immediately contacted support via email after finding no "fixes" on the Sony website. We received a reply with instructions to try "resetting" the TV, which we did but it didn't work. We were then told that it would need repair and that we had to Call Sony Support on a NON-800# (on OUR dime) & ONLY between the hours of 9:00 - 5:00 pm (ET) M-F. We called on that Monday following (on Christmas Eve) at 7:30 am PT and got a person who would not believe that we had already gone through the reset steps with the other support person via email. We had to do it all over again with this person. He was difficult to understand and was a bit arrogant. So far this buying experience sucks. We're now concerned that the 55" is going to do the same...if it does, it better occur during the warranty period.What's somewhat funny, although sad too, is that we own a circa 1975 Sony Trinitron (dial-NO remote)that I got as a Christmas gift while in high school that still works! Instead of the rabbit ears, we've hooked it up to cable & a VCR to change the channels (we set the TV to channel 3).We're waiting to get a call from a "local" repair person. Not too optimistic at this point, especially since it is the week of Christmas & many people will be calling customer support because they've found out their brand new Sony TVs that they got for Christmas are junk.

Reviews.Title: WOW - perfect picture even without tweaking
Reviews.Author: Power User
Reviews.Content: Bought an LG but ran into the same probem many others had that the LG Truemotion is not really on the 2012 LG sets yet despite thier advertising.  Couldn't wait for the LG firmware upgrade (some people waiting 6 months) so I tried the 46" Sony HX750 instead.  WOW - no comparison.  The Sony was more expensive but worth every penny.  Sports are incredibly clear, etc.  I also use the variable output jack on the Sony to feed directly into a subwoofer.  Really adds depth to the TV speakers.  Can only do that with Sony (only ones offering the variable audio output).  Thanks Sony and thanks Amazon for a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: A great TV from Sony
Reviews.Author: Hal
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace my 2008 Sony XBR 40" model. I wanted to get a larger screen and also to have 3D capability. I am a big Sony fan, so this was perfect opportunity for me. This (46") TV is no.longer offered by Sony, so now was the time to buy and get a great price. This TV has a really great picture. Setup was easy, as it was the same as my old Sony TV. There two issues which prevents me from giving it 5 stars. The online TV guide does NOT work because the company that used to broadcast it over the air no longer does so. If you hook the TV up to the internet (I am told by Sony support) you can get the guide information. The speakers are just awful as the sound has no bass or richness at all. I have fixed this problem by buying an "under the TV" Dolby sound system. In spite of these two issues, I love the TV and the picture quality just can't be any better. I am limited in the screen size I can use in my living room (50" max) so this 46" Sony was just the thing. I would recommend this TV highly. If you're thinking about buying it, you might not want to wait until they are sold out!I am updating my review, now that I have had time to use my TV for a while. I connected it with the Internet and that made all the difference in the world! The TV updated its' software and many new/improved features were added. Plus now I can access many things on the Internet for free! I have also had the opportunity to try out the 3D mode and it is just great!! I just wanted to update my review to say that I am so very glad I bought this Sony TV and would recommend it to everyone. Buy it, you won't regret it!! Also, the online TV guide now works, just as Sony told me it would! Get this TV and connect it to the Internet..

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: drcjo
Reviews.Content: I shopped for this TV for months. The open box "like new" along with the Square Trade Warranty was a good . The TV was in excellent shape and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I ever purchased
Reviews.Author: Frank Reese
Reviews.Content: Love it! Works perfectly. I am just a regular TV viewer so I cant give all of the technical aspects of this TV. Clearest hi-def screen I have ever seen. Internet capabilities are wonderful. I use to stream movies like Netflix, Hulu, etc. 3D looks awesome. Works seamlessly with playstation gaming system. Its quite an entertainment experience. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Leonard Zucker
Reviews.Content: Does everything you want a TV to do, very good picture, nice style at an affordable price.  Remote control is not lit and not easy to use compared to others.

Reviews.Title: Good replacement for the burned out Panasonic
Reviews.Author: ALLAN BRAATEN
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace the Panasonic that went down after two years. Blacks are not as saturated as the plasma Panasonic but the colors are nice and it works well with both streaming and blu-ray. Better to watch in bright room than Panasonic and definitely does not have the heat coming off it like a plasma. Like the thin, light weight aspects, easier to mount and manipulate. Have bought Sony in the past and will buy again. Hopefully this set lasts.

Reviews.Title: Crisp and amazing picture
Reviews.Author: J. Molitor "J Dog"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Sony Bravia that I've purchased.  Each one consistently provides a first-class TV experience. The picture is crisp and clear, the 240 Hz minimizes any refresh-rate issues.  When I watch football, I feel like I'm in the huddle. Realizing that the audio features of the Bravia are "lack-luster", I supplemented each installation with a version of a Bose sound system.  This combination creates a VERY NICE television watching experience.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!  Especially for a bright room
Reviews.Author: The Coach
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV with a great picture for a very bright sunroom with a lot of windows.  My previous plasma had a good amount of glare which made it very annoying to watch during the day.  After doing a lot of research, I ordered the KDL46HX750.  The TV has a "matte-type" finish and looks very good in a bright room.  Obviously nothing is going to be perfect with a bright room, but this TV handles the ambient light very well and gives off very little glare during the day.Overall, the picture quality is top notch (after some adjusting of the settings), fast moving sports look great, and the internet features work very well.  I would highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: What a great picture!
Reviews.Author: Robert G. McNally
Reviews.Content: I have had Sony's for years and years and will buy no other brand.  This TV is the best I've ever purchased.  It has the best picture, the 3D option is awesome, a very easy interface to access the internet, Netflix, 3D or your cable provider.  The setup was a piece of cake and very intuitive, it took all of 5 mins to set the whole thing up including the wireless.  The viewing of sports is awesome with the motion technology.  My only regret is not buying the larger set.  This was a 2nd TV for us so I saved a few $$ getting the 46 but in hindsight, I should have bought the larger one.  The product delivery was on time and as advertised.  I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Quality
Reviews.Author: sega gamer
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because I wanted to play my games in 3D. I wanted great picture, great 3D through active glasses, and an affordable price. With all 3 checked out, it wasn't too hard to see that compared to other models and brands that this was a winner.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality of image and features for the price
Reviews.Author: Hermano C. Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Full HD image is perfect, no shading. Very easy to setup and create your own profile, Internet apps work well. Interfacing with other Sony products (blu-ray, soundbar) is impressive!

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Jessi Mattson
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about a month now. I absolutely love it. My only complaint is that Sony uses Opera as a web browser, which means flash content is not available.

Reviews.Title: My Office/Den TV
Reviews.Author: Will T.
Reviews.Content: This TV is very clear and you can see all the details of the picture - crystal clear. I have all Bravia entertainment equipment.

Reviews.Title: Perfect picture view and color. And fast shipping.
Reviews.Author: KATINA "K2"
Reviews.Content: This purchased to replace my old one also Sony TV 15 years old. Nothing wrong, just up grade new model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice!
Reviews.Author: Gowkrat
Reviews.Content: I was looking like crazy for a good deal on a TV during black Friday and there were quite a few different ones I liked, but I went for this TV and I am so glad I did!I have to say Its beautiful it has excellent Colors, Fast Internet Connection, 3D is Awesome, Size is Perfect for my Living room, Price was 999.98 with free two day shipping totally worth it, Great Sony and of course Amazon Customer Service, Great Apps.As an owner of one of these TV's I really cannot see nothing wrong with it, I do recommend it to anyone looking for a good TV. I can watch my Amazon prime videos, Netflix and another plus Amazon forgot to mention is Sony is giving free 6 months of Hulu plus with this TV and 6 months of Slacker Premium Radio here is the Link by the way.[...]there is also one Sony app on the play store to use your phone as a remote its "Media Remote" and its works great with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: doug b
Reviews.Content: This is the first 3D TV that I've owned, so I can't really compare it to other 3D models but I have owned several HD TV's and this TV easily has the best picture.  HD programming looks great, PS3 games look great and of course blu rays look great.  I bought this to replace a 46 inch 120 Hz toshiba LED that was less than 2 years old due to the massive amount of motion blur it had and after watching 2 football games, The Avengers blu ray and about 2 hours of PS3 gaming I am very satisfied with this TV.  As far as the sound goes it's  not any worse than should be expected for TV speakers.  I did consider taking off a star because of the bolt pattern for mounting and the condition of the box upon arrival but I was still able to use my off-brand wall mount and nothing inside the box was damaged, so neither one of these things had any effect on the TV's performance.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Im pretty happy with the product, i'm no tech savy but I'm pretty happy with this purchase so far so good.  Awesome picture, easy navigation of menus and love the media remote, and my amazon and Netflix apps.  3D picture is awesome, although I little uncomfortable with the heavy glasses, I already got used to them but i cannot see more than one movie without resting but thats common sense.

Reviews.Title: Sony TV
Reviews.Author: Sindi
Reviews.Content: Great 3D, internet TV. Nice picture and easy to operate. Came with a free Sony Blue Ray Player 2!  I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: nicky camidge
Reviews.Content: No problems.  Happy with choice.  Picture clarity and color is the best ever.  The internet tie in makes for a whole new  dimension.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality but other features need improvement
Reviews.Author: Prince
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is nice. Sometimes color pixels seem very dark but overall quality is good. Black pixels do not look dark black when room is well-lit. Internet speed on TV is very slow even with wired connection of 5-10Mbps speed. With wi-fi connection it takes hours to connect. Browser is uselessly slow, you need lot of patience to type on it and then wait for webpages to load. Have not tried the 3D quality yet. Sound quality is good. Onscreen keyboard is tricky and needs a lot of practice.Overall it's a good product but needs a lot of improvements in the 'smart'ness aspect of it. Otherwise go for any non-smart 3D TV  with Roku. You'll have a cheaper option :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Josh Jago
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. Crystal clear display. Great for TV and gaming. The only con is the web based application. They run very slow, but the do not affect the value of the TV. I've had this TV for a year now with no issues.

Reviews.Title: A great buy
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Keele "kaosofares"
Reviews.Content: Being primarily a Sony fan, I found this TV to be extraordinary. For the price, when you can easily get slightly higher specs for a bit more money, this TV is affordable and it works. This is my first LED TV, and I wonder how I ever watched without it. Games look great, movies, Television, even the apps work well. I primarily use my PS3 to do a lot of streaming, but every now and then I like to crank it out of this and it works. Even music on it is great. I always blast Pandora/Slacker out of it, and with my sound system it sounds and looks great! I would recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable mid-range television.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: marissa bocanegra
Reviews.Content: I returned my Samsung 55" for the SONY 46" and I couldnt be happier.  The draw back on the Samsung 55" 120HZ was the "ghosting" effect or lag.  The SONY 240HZ has none of this.  This is a great TV!

Reviews.Title: Perfect clarity and lots of connections
Reviews.Author: Stephen J. Callahan
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement for my wall mount in the kitchen.  Wow – super sharp and loaded with networking capability.  You cannot beat Sony for clarity.

Reviews.Title: nice TV.
Reviews.Author: kansasroamer
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this television has the finest quality picture of any television I have owned or seen.  Just beautiful.  I have not had an opportunity to use the internet features or the 3D but am looking forward to the experience.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Venessa
Reviews.Content: The picture quality, the 3d experience and the features are great. This television met my expectations and more! If any of you are looking for a 46. Inch led  smart tv at a reasonable price, this is the one

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: KM
Reviews.Content: I bought first generation 55" version and liked so much I got this unit or the bedroom.  It has 3D transmitter installed inside instead of a separate unit.  It's picture is crystal clear.  And weight is less than 60lbs.

Reviews.Title: so far good
Reviews.Author: indra.sanichar
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the quality of this TV. The graphics is great. The slim design awesome. Sound is very good.

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: Roger Jesús
Reviews.Content: tremendo producto, lo recomiendo 100 % , muy buena relación costo-beneficio !!! excelente imagen muy satisfecho con el producto que nos brinda la Sony !!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Passingas
Reviews.Content: What I wanted from the TV was simple - an excellent picture.  This TV delivered.  Blu-ray is killer.  Sports are nice and smooth with no ghosting.  The television itself looks great.I can't comment on the wifi, apps, or 3D because I don't use them.Why not 5 stars?  Because the sound sucks.  That's par for the course with these ultra thin HDTVs, but it's still disappointing.  HT-CT260 sound bar, here I come....

Reviews.Title: incredible value compared to the sony ex720 40"
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Sulton
Reviews.Content: i chose this product because the bx series didnt have 3d(duh) and the ex720 40" was only 100$ less. better deal.  built in wifi, 3d, smart tv, not passing it up.  btw awesome resolution

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: Neutral opinion
Reviews.Content: So far it is good, but have never tried the 3D yed. . . . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: Sony does it again!
Reviews.Author: Timothy Watson
Reviews.Content: I replaced a 15-year old Sony with this one.  I have been more than impressed by this TV!  The picture is awesome.  I even enjoy the 3D capabilities more than I thought I would!It has internet apps like Facebook, Amazon Internet Video, Hulu Plus, and YouTube.  I like these apps more than I thought I would.  The YouTube videos look better on my TV than on my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: DeeDee
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing! I bought it for my boyfriend and for our living room. We had it for about a month and half now. It has a very clear and vivid picture. I notice at the corners of the TV, you can see light coming in. I read about that and it was something about the LED. But it isn't anything big or annoying because I don't notice during movies,just mainly during load up screens. It is great for watching movies, and 3D is amazing! As for gaming, we mainly use it with our ps3 and pictures look awesome as well and I don't notice any input lag. I've seen TVs that give off a shutter when any motion is too fast but this TV doesn't show any of that. One con would be the very week WiFi signal and it is easier if you connect your LAN cable instead when using the Apps.

Reviews.Title: Display problems
Reviews.Author: Badger Boy
Reviews.Content: My Sony Bravia lasted 18 months before it started blacking out and needed to be turned off and back on in order to reset the picture.Sony 'offered' to replace their faulty TV with a 'refurbished' model for $600 + tax.I don't think so - try other brands - you won't get much sympathy from 'Sony customer support'.Disappointed that I paid $1200 and only got 18 months of use out of it - in fact, I'm still paying on it for another 6 months.Sony used to have great and reliable products - now what?

Reviews.Title: Some Impressions
Reviews.Author: A. Person
Reviews.Content: OK, I am editing this (March 25th) to better summarize it now that I've tried most of what I wanted to try.Design- The tv does not have monolithic glass like CNET listed it as having, unless I am totally crazy or misunderstanding the term.  The screen is even difficult to figure out as far as matte or not... so I am assuming it's semi-gloss.  The stand is much less wobbly compared with the 2011 Sony stands.  The remote control is much smaller than last year's.  The component and composite inputs are now normal old school ones rather than you needing an included converter cable.Performance- The picture has a lot of pop and seems overall good.  To me personally the black level looks to be good as well.  However, I have no idea how that's even possible since it does not have local dimming and is edge lit.  So we'll see what measurements someone such as CNET gets (they are supposedly reviewing this set soon).  All these sites say this has "frame dimming".  Well there is no menion of it in the manual and I am starting to have a feeling Sony simply called the stupid light limiter feature frame dimming where people would think it's similar to local dimming by referring to it as a similar name.  There is no setting anywhere which sounds like any sort of local dimming feature of any sort!More Performance (lol)- The uniformity and viewing angles seem good for an led set.  Seems better than the 2011 sets.  I tried the nx720, hx729, hx820, and hx929 and in my opinion this has better viewing angles.  HOWEVER, here are the big issues with the set... it has horrible reflections and horrible bleedthrough/flashlighting.  The reflections are worse than the MANY tvs I tried last year.  The ONLY tv I have EVER tried which had mroe reflections is the LG LM7600!  If you don't have a light opposite the screen then maybe it will be ok, but it's hard for me to figure a good way of lighting my room without this lamp opposite the tv.  As for flashlighting... I do NOT believe people who say they have an edge lit led without flashlighting, no matter how dim the settings.  I have tried way too many top notch tvs (for edge lit) and they all have it.  Even the full array hx929 had flashlighting on BOTH sets I tried.  I would say this has the same amount the NX720 had.3D Performance- The main area I have not yet tested.  I do have 2012 Panasonic universal standard 3d glasses, which are supposed to work for Panasonic, Sony, and Samsung tvs.... so I can try it soon hopefully.Gaming- The gaming seems good.  This supposedly has a 4x speed 3D panel, which apparently does not affect gaming, though, because the lag still is not earth shatteringly different than usual.  I only tried seeing what Rock Band 3 would list it as and in Game mode it keeps being between 18ms and 32ms.  Hard to know exactly when using that game as a measure, but I have been doing VERY good on the songs so it must be close.  I even got high scores on some songs I had done badly on with other tvs recently.  I would say the lag is not worse than the Panasonic 50ST50, which I also tried.  The numbers could barely say so, but it didn't feel right when playing on it for some reason.  And by the way... last year game mode on the Sonys forced you to use dynamic audio.  This year it forces standard and with a separate setting you can turn surround on or off... which is nice because I hated being forced to hear surround sounding music last year if using tv speakers.  The speakers seem a bit better than last yar as well.The Panasonic 50ST50 I guarantee you is the best tv you can get right now.  BUT I get head issues from plasmas.  This tv gave me some headaches too, but I'm still trying to figure out if it's truly related to this tv or maybe left over from the plasma.Either way, reflections and flashlighting are trhe real issues with this set.  I may end up keeping it anyway if I can't get somehow adjusted to the plasma.  I would say yes for a 46 inch tv the best bet for an LCD is still the HX929, but it does have worse viewing angles and cost more.  I don't think I would even want to try the HX850.  Why spend $2100 for that when you can get the HX929 full array for the same price?So I guess your viewing environment is the main thing to consider when determining whether or not this tv will be good for you.  How they have the reflections so much worse than last year I don't know.  Maybe from trying to get that extra pop from a tv that is apparently semi-matte.  At least this is better than the LG, which has even worse feflections and atrocious gameplay lag.EDIT:  I just saw a comemrcial with text on the screen and it looked inky black.  It just makes no sense to me how it can be true though without local dimming.  Although, I do remember CNET saying some Samsungs achieved quite good black levels without local dimming.  But not inky.  So am I imagining things or is it really inky?  Who knows.  lol  Maybe the frame dimming is indeed a feature, but you can't turn it off and is automatic or something.More Notes: The cool illuminated Sony logo from the 2011 models is NOT on this one.  I thought that was a cool feature too!  Also, the sound quality form the tv speakers seems better than 2011.  I believe the NX720 was the one where the audio was atrociously bad.  These are at least decent.  Also on some dark scenes which I know from past viewing on tvs that there was a klot of noise in the picture on those tvs, it seemed much more crystal clear on this one.I guess I did imagine the good black level, because the sole bad comment about the tv in the CNET review is that it has a poor black level.  U did ntoice the picture looks washed out, but black text looked really black to me persopnally.This seems better for gaming than the Panny as I tried that again today and it was being bad.  So now who knows what i will do.  Probably either keep the plasma and use it rarely or else maybe try the hx929 again, but that bothered my ehad in some way as well and costs much much more than the plasma.

Reviews.Title: Love Sony Brand
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: Because this product is very goodNothing can't replace sony brand in matters of qualityI think that work to satisfy consumers.

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Rohilla
Reviews.Content: This is the right product which I was looking for. It is very good one and perfectly matching with my requirement. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: Sun
Reviews.Content: We just got it. It is easy to set up and to run. I still need to do some fine tuning.

Reviews.Title: does not play well with the sound bar
Reviews.Author: mh
Reviews.Content: I figured I woud be safe buying SONY product for both parts, that was not the case, see my other review for the HTCT260 picture is good enough but I wish they would play nice with each other

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD Picture
Reviews.Author: blueridgeboy
Reviews.Content: We researched the purchase of our TV using Consumer Reports and reading many Amazon reviews on the models we were most interested in.  Both led us to this Sony BRAVIA, which we're thoroughly enjoying, and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: I hate this TV
Reviews.Author: S. Hyvonen ""metallic proghead""
Reviews.Content: I truly hate it.  I'm not a hateful person, but this piece of consumer electronics makes me have those negative feelings.Others have covered the picture quality etc. very well here, and yes - the picture quality is very good.  I haven't tried 3D, but anything 2D is great.  But..The Netflix implementation is the worst I've seen anywhere, and I have watched Netflix through many different gadgets (Roku, TiVo, PS3, Panasonic BluRay player, PCs, tablets, cell phones). Let me elaborate (and this is a true story).Imagine that your kid would like to watch a cartoon on the TV from Netflix.  Ok, you turn on the TV, and you click the red Netflix button on the remote... nothing happens.  You click it again.  Nothing happens.  Third click gives you a message "Powering up..." Ok fine, I'll wait, I guess Netflix will start soon.After waiting and waiting, I press the button again.  This time, the message is "Feature not available".  Huh!?  What does that mean.  I swear my internet is up and running, and Netflix still works on my phone, so their servers are fine.  I click it again.  "Feature not available".  Another click. "Feature not available."  Frustrated, I go to the kitchen to get something to drink, asking the kid to play with something instead of watching the cartoon.When I come back from the kitchen, suddenly the TV program that was on disappears and the screen goes black.  What - did it break now?  After a few seconds, I get a red Netflix screen (very similar to the one you see when you launch Netflix from PS3).  It's loading something (horribly slowly... PS3 is faste).  Then, after another looong wait, I get to the menu to pick what I want to watch.  The TV responds to buttons extremely slowly (it's like it's thinking or doing something in the background).  I pick Dora the explorer and it starts playing.The kid is happy, sits down and starts watching.  After two minutes, the screen goes blank!  Sony logo appears - apparently the TV decided to reboot.  Great..  CBS comes on.  The kid has a tantrum: "NO!  I don't want to watch this program - I wanna watch Dora!!"  I start frantically pressing the red Netflix button again.  "Feature not available", "Feature not available", "Feature not available", "Feature not available"...  I wait, hoping that it starts by itself (just like last time).  Nothing, nothing for five minutes.  I press the Netflix button again. "Feature not available".In desparation, I go to the "Home" menu... that starts after a short wait.  I look for the Netflix icon there - I swear I've seen it there before.  This time, I don't see it there... and many others (like NHL icon) are gone too.  Confused, I click on "Internet Content" (at this point the kid is crying in the background).  A new screen appears, saying "Acquiring Internet Content" (or something to that effect).  A little bright dot starts going across the screen, over and over again (I guess it's an indication if content being 'acquired').This took FOORREEVEER (ok, it felt like forever when the boy is crying - in reality, it took 7 minutes.. and my internet is FiOS fast, and the TV was connected with an ethernet cable).  Then, finally, the TV is done 'acquiring', and goes back to the Home menu.  Lo and behold - now the Netflix icon is there, along with all the others that were missing.  Clicking it launches Netflix again (and just as slowly as before).After navigating the menus again (difficult when the TV is stuck thinking about something, but if you click the up/down/left/right buttons too many times - which you will, since nothing happens - the TV buffers them, and when it finally finishes "thinking", it responds to all those presses in a row, moving the cursor several rows down, past the row you actually wanted... how frustrating!!)., I'm able to finally launch Dora again, and this time the TV is happy and doesn't reboot.This is not a one-time occurance... this has happened to me three times now in a span of three months.  It's like the TV suddenly decides, in the middle of a working netflix stream, that it's "internet content" needs to be updated, reboots and waits for the user to initiate that internet content update (without ever actually letting the user know this is what needs to happen).  Awful - just awful.  And if the user accidentally figures out how to update, the TV updates ALL THE CONTENT instead of just the Netflix one (why else would it take 7min?).Oh, and the initial wait for getting the Netflix program/app to start after turning on the TV takes about 4-5 minutes, E-V-E-R-Y  S-I-N-G-L-E  T-I-M-E.  Consistently.  I contacted Sony customer service (chat) about this.  They asked me to refresh the TV's firmware (or software or whatever they called it) - difficult to find from the menus.  I did that in the hopes of this issue going away... it didn't.  After that, they told me to update the internet content..Great.  Why doesn't this happen with PS3 - another Sony product?  Why doesn't it happen with any of the other gadgets I use to watch Netflix?  Why is the whole TV so slow??So, bottom line: if you want this TV for watching TV, or 3D movies off your 3D bluray player, go for it.  If you want it for its "smart" features, I suggest you instead choose to shoot yourself in the foot with a BB gun, repeatedly, for about 10min - it's less painful.As for me, I had another Internet Content Acquisition fiasco tonight that broke the camel's back.  Right after I submit this review, I'm gonna buy a Roku.
